app.name: EVA
app.one_liner: EVA is an AI-assisted penetration testing agent that guides users through complete pentest engagements with AI-powered attack strategy, autonomous command generation, and real-time vulnerability analysis.

screens.name: EVA Pentest Shell
screens.purpose: Primary interface for interacting with the AI pentesting agent, executing commands, and navigating sessions.

rust_commands.name: execute_command
rust_commands.purpose: Execute system or enumeration commands suggested by the AI during pentest workflow and capture output for analysis.

rust_commands.name: generate_report
rust_commands.purpose: Generate HTML/PDF vulnerability assessment reports and attack surface maps from session data.

rust_commands.name: search_vulnerabilities
rust_commands.purpose: Perform AI-assisted vulnerability or exploit searches using the --search CLI flag.

rust_commands.name: configure_eva
rust_commands.purpose: Open configuration interface to set EVA variables via --config flag.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement session management and AI backend selection
week 1: Build core command execution and output parsing
week 1: Integrate basic vulnerability detection logic
week 1: Add report generation for HTML/PDF
acceptance_tests: User can launch EVA and select a new session.
User can choose Anthropic Claude as AI backend and define a target.
EVA suggests and executes reconnaissance commands, parses output correctly.
Vulnerability is identified and added to session; report is generated in HTML.
CLI flags like --search and --config function as described in v3.1 release.
